articles.author: MPX
articles.title: 2020 vision: Which Democrats will jump in the race first?
articles.description: We've met the midterms, now we have 2020 Vision! Looking ahead to the next election, we look at outgoing Colorado Governor John Hickenlooper's announcement, and immediate walk back, to run for president.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Newly elected House Dem Colin Allred prioritizes...
articles.description: Congressman-elect Collin Allred (D-Texas) joins MTP Daily two days after winning his race against House Rules Committee Chairman Pete Sessions.

articles.title: DOJ shakeup means more risk for Trump, peril for Mueller probe
articles.description: WaPo’s Devlin Barrett, NYT’s Katie Benner, former DOJ spox Matt Miller, former US attorney Harry Litman, and AP’s Jonathan Lemire on the timing of Sessions firing, the appointment of Matt Whitaker and new questions it raises about the special counsel’s invest…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: With Sessions out, is Mueller closing in on Don Jr. ?
articles.description: Daily Beast’s Sam Stein, Move On’s Karine Jean-Pierre, AP’s Jonathan Lemire, and NYT’s Nick Confessore on reports surrounding the special counsel’s scrutiny of the President’s oldest son

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Report: new acting AG already declared “no collusion” before taking over DOJ
articles.description: Daily Beast’s Sam Stein, Move On’s Karine Jean-Pierre, AP’s Jonathan Lemire, and NYT’s Nick Confessore on the new Daily Beast report indicating Matt Whitaker previously made up his mind about the Mueller investigation before taking over for Jeff Sessions

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Fox News' coverage of the caravan drops after midterm election
articles.description: Right after the midterm elections, Fox News and the president stopped talking about the caravan.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Warner hopes GOP colleagues 'stick to their guns' on...
articles.description: Sen. Mark Warner (D-Va.) joins Chuck to discuss Jeff Sessions' exit from the DOJ and what it means for the future of the Mueller investigation.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Warner: Investigations into Trump admin. 'appropriate oversight,' not 'harassment'
articles.description: Sen. Mark Warner (D-Va.) explains why Democrats are not worried about Mitch McConnell's claim that investigations into the president amount to "presidential harassment."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Tribe: Installation of Whitaker is unconstitutional
articles.description: Harvard Law School Professor Laurence Tribe joins Katy Tur to discuss what the resignation of Jeff Sessions means for the Mueller investigation, and how his replacement, Matt Whitaker, plays in.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Democrats pick up more gains in House as key races are called
articles.description: Democrats increased their gain in the House to 31 seats after races were called in Georgia, Washington and California. The Co-Founder and managing editor of "The Beat DC," Tiffany Cross and strategist Rick Tyler join Katy Tur to discuss the implications.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Mucarsel-Powell on CA shooting: This cannot be our new normal
articles.description: In the wake of the mass shooting in Thousand Oaks, CA, congresswoman-elect Debbie Mucarsel-Powell (D-FL) tells Ali Velshi what fueled her successful campaign platform of reducing gun violence in America and why families “are expecting action.”

articles.title: As Dems eye disclosure, Trump struggles...
articles.description: The new Democratic majority is making no secret of their plans to get Donald Trump's tax returns. The president's latest excuses probably won't cut it.
articles.content: Donald Trump told a reporter the other day that he considers himself an open book. The president repeated the line at yesterday’s White House press conference, agreeing, I think I am an open book. With that in mind, a reporter asked Mr. Transparency a fairly … [+2521 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How Sessions' replacement feels about the Mueller investigation
articles.description: Watch this break down of what can happen to the Mueller investigation under Jeff Sessions' replacement, Acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: New Acting AG once criticized scope of Mueller investigation
articles.description: Acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker is a known critic of the scope of Special Counsel Mueller's investigation prompting questions on whether he should recuse himself from the investigation.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: From the GOP's 'convict caucus' to the...
articles.description: Two Republican congressmen were indicted on federal criminal charges over the summer. They ran for re-election anyway. Voters didn't seem to care.
articles.content: Over the summer, voters were introduced to the convict caucus : three Republican ex-cons, two of whom recently served time behind bars, who launched high-profile congressional campaigns, confident that voters would look past their criminal convictions. As reg… [+1822 chars]

articles.title: House Dems eye new measures following...
articles.description: In the wake of the latest mass shooting, the new House Democratic majority is already eyeing a change in the political conversation over gun violence.

articles.description: Pennsylvania Republican Congressman Ryan Costello unleashes on President Trump's assertion that Republicans lost races because they didn't embrace Trump, saying they’re losing because voters are outraged by the president.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: ‘He had every intention of going in there and saving lives’: Ventura County PIO on Sgt. Ron Helus
articles.description: Sergeant Eric Buschow is the Press Information Officer for the Ventura County Sheriff's office, he joins Craig Melvin to discuss the latest on the shooting in California.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Former Gov. Christie under consideration for AG post
articles.description: Former New Jersey Governor Chris Christie was spotted at the White House just a day after the much anticipated firing of Jeff Sessions as U.S. Attorney General. Christie is on a shortlist of candidates the president is considering as a replacement to Sessions.

articles.content: Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country. * Things are likely to get a little messy in Maine’s 2nd congressional district, where incumbent Rep. Bruce Poliquin (R) is ahead by 0.3%, but where the winner will be determined by t… [+1731 chars]

articles.title: Trump is eager to tell you about the Dems who secretly agree with him
articles.description: Trump thinks Democrats are with him on a border wall and government regulation of social media companies. They're really not.
articles.content: One of the stranger developments in Republican politics this year is the campaign against tech giants and social media companies, which the right sees as conspiring against conservatives. Some GOP members of Congress and prominent Republican media figures hav… [+3057 chars]

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Putting the GOP's House losses in context...
articles.description: GOP House losses in 2018 are higher than the historical average and the worst for a GOP president since the 1974 midterms in the aftermath of Watergate.
articles.content: There is no consensus about the precise definition of a wave election, so there’s been a fair amount of debate since Tuesday night about whether Democratic gains this year meet the standard. Whether the argument is constructive or not is a matter of perspecti… [+1622 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Dem sees areas where both parties can work together
articles.description: Rep. Eric Swalwell, D-Calif., discusses the breaking news of a mass shooting in Thousand Oaks, California as well as the results of the midterm elections and President Trump's move to fire AG Jeff Sessions.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Police: California shooter's handgun had magazine modification
articles.description: The suspect in a California shooting which left 12 dead, including a responding police officer, used a legally purchased handgun which had a magazine modification.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Incoming Michigan gov looks to infrastructure issues
articles.description: Gretchen Whitmer, the governor-elect of Michigan, joins Morning Joe to discuss her campaign and why she's looking to dig into the state's infrastructure issues when she takes office.

articles.title: Georgia Dem flips district formerly held by Gingrich, Tom Price
articles.description: Georgia's 6th district was represented for decades by Newt Gingrich and Tom Price. Now the seat will be held by a progressive Democrat.
articles.content: House Democratic candidates flipped all kinds of districts in every part of the country this week, but some stand out more than others. Take Georgia’s 6th, for example. U.S. Rep. Karen Handel on Thursday conceded to Democrat Lucy McBath in the 6th District co… [+2649 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Justice Ginsburg breaks ribs after falling in office
articles.description: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg fell in her office at the Supreme Court. Tests showed that she fractured three ribs on her left side. She was admitted for observation and treatment at the George Washington University Hospital.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Manchin: The people of W. Va. want their guy
articles.description: Sen. Joe Manchin, D-W. Va., discusses his midterm win, his message to the new Congress, not agreeing with the president 100 percent of the time, winning as a Dem in a red state and gun reform.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Trump thinks he's come up with a...
articles.description: When Donald Trump suggests he has a secret plan to solve an intractable problem, I'd recommend some skepticism.

articles.title: Dems must practice responsible oversight: Rep. Ryan
articles.description: Rep. Tim Ryan, D-Ohio, assesses the outcome of the midterm elections and if he believes Nancy Pelosi should return to her House Speaker position.

articles.title: Trump taps partisan loyalist to oversee Justice Dept, Mueller probe
articles.description: Trump's choice to oversee the Justice Department and the Mueller investigation is a partisan loyalist who spent months condemning the Mueller investigation.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump keeps doubling down on a losing strategy
articles.description: During a Wednesday news conference, the president criticized CNN reporter Jim Acosta and referred to a question from PBS reporter Yamiche Alcindor as 'racist.' The Morning Joe panel discusses Trump's remarks.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: With midterms done, where's the caravan talk?
articles.description: Now that the midterms have passed, is the migrant caravan still the big story for the Trump WH and Republicans that it was before the elections? The panel discusses.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Joe: Donald Trump was freaked out yesterday
articles.description: Democrats had the biggest House gains in the 2018 midterms since Watergate, but Donald Trump appeared to be in denial about those wins. The Morning Joe panel recaps the midterms and the president's Wednesday news conference.

articles.title: Panicked by Democrats, Trump installs loyalist to top DoJ spot
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reports on how Donald Trump, in fear of the coming House Democratic oversight of his administration, has arranged for Trump loyalist and Mueller critic Matthew Whitaker to take over the top spot at the DoJ.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOP hurt by Donald Trump bungling in Democratic midterm victories
articles.description: Rachel Maddow highlights some of the impressive Democratic gains in Tuesday's election results and points out how Donald Trump's clumsy political sense ended up hurting Republicans in several House races.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: 'Un-called' congressional race could be another Democratic flip
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reports on an adjustment in the vote count in a New Mexico congressional race that local news outlets report puts Democrat Xochitl Torres Small ahead of Republican Yvette Herrell for the seat vacated this year by Republican Steve Pearce.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump after scorched-Earth campaign: I'm a 'great moral leader'
articles.description: The president called himself a 'great moral leader' during a combative White House press conference when pressed on some of his fear-mongering & rhetoric leading up to the midterm elections. Jon Meacham & Rick Wilson discuss.

articles.title: Senators caution Trump on obstruction of Mueller investigation
articles.description: Senator Chris Coons talks with Rachel Maddow about his bill to protect Robert Mueller's investigation from Donald Trump, and past warnings senators from both parties have given Trump on abusing his power to obstruct the Russia investigation.

articles.title: After Trump fires Sessions, Democrats move to protect Mueller

articles.title: 'Sit down!' Trump berates reporters in fiery press conference
articles.description: Trump's White House barred a reporter from the grounds hours after a combative press conference where the president repeatedly shouted down reporters. Peter Baker & Jill Colvin react.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: On Tuesday Dems won the House. On Wednesday? Trump fired Sessions
articles.description: The day after Democrats took back the House in the midterm elections, Trump took over the news cycle firing Attorney General Jeff Sessions. Democrats are now concerned Trump will attempt to derail the Mueller investigation. Jeremy Bash, Joyce Vance, Robert Co…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Rep. Swalwell: We are able to protect Mueller
articles.description: Rep. Eric Swalwell tells Lawrence that "the days of free passes" for Pres. Trump are over now that democrats have won back control of the House. Rep. Swalwell also reveals what House control means for seeing Trump's tax returns.

articles.title: Watergate prosecutor on Sessions' firing

articles.title: Election highlights voter suppression efforts in GA, ND
articles.description: We saw example after example of an electoral system designed to make it harder for people to vote - voter ID laws, broken machines, registration problems, and insanely long lines.

articles.description: Amid an onslaught of news, don't forget: there were a lot of notable Republican defeats and Democratic wins on Tuesday night.

articles.title: Matthews on Sessions firing: This won’t be the last time Trump...
articles.description: Trump struck and it won’t be the last time. He took out his AG and replaced him with a yes-man. Chris says he wants to eliminate a man who could destroy his presidency.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump attacks media in post-Midterms press conference
articles.description: Yamiche Alcindor joins Hardball to talk about her question to President Trump during Wednesday’s press conference. The President was visibly upset from the question on what he thinks of people seeing his rhetoric as emboldening white nationalists.

articles.title: After Sessions firing, lawmakers propose Plan B to protect...
articles.description: Sen. Richard Blumenthal confirmed to NBC News that talks are underway for a “Plan B” to protect the Mueller probe if Trump tries to end the investigation. Talks have been in the works since May but recent developments with Jeff Sessions have renewed calls.

articles.title: Sessions replacement has history of criticizing Mueller probe
